movie.title: The Last Unicorn
movie.description: A beautiful unicorn sets out to learn if she truly is the last of her kind in this sparkling animated musical.

book.title: The Last Unicorn
book.author: Peter S. Beagle
book.description: The Last Unicorn is a fantasy novel by American author Peter S. Beagle and published in 1968, by Viking Press in the U.S. and The Bodley Head in the U.K. It follows the tale of a unicorn, who believes she is the last of her kind in the world and undertakes a quest to discover what has happened to the other unicorns.

movie.title: Ender's Game
movie.description: Young Ender Wiggin is recruited by the International Military to lead the fight against the Formics, an insectoid alien race who had previously tried to invade Earth and had inflicted heavy losses on humankind.

book.title: Ender's Game
book.author: Orson Scott Card
book.description: Ender's Game is a 1985 military science fiction novel by American author Orson Scott Card. Set at an unspecified date in Earth's future, the novel presents an imperiled humankind after two conflicts with an insectoid alien species they dub 'the buggers'.

movie.title: The Fellowship of the Ring
movie.description: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

book.title: The Fellowship of the Ring
book.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book.description: The first of three volumes of the epic novel The Lord of the Rings by the English author J. R. R. Tolkien; it is followed by The Two Towers and The Return of the King. The action takes place in the fictional universe of Middle-earth.

movie.title: The Hunger Games
movie.description: Katniss Everdeen voluntarily takes her younger sister's place in the Hunger Games: a televised competition in which two teenagers from each of the twelve Districts of Panem are chosen at random to fight to the death.

book.title: The Hunger Games
book.author: Suzanne Collins
book.description: The Hunger Games follows 16-year-old Katniss Everdeen, a girl from District 12 who volunteers for the 74th Hunger Games in place of her younger sister Primrose Everdeen.

movie.title: Twilight
movie.description: When Bella Swan moves to a small town in the Pacific Northwest, she falls in love with Edward Cullen, a mysterious classmate who reveals himself to be a 108-year-old vampire.

book.title: Twilight
book.author: Stephenie Meyer
book.description: Twilight introduces seventeen-year-old Isabella 'Bella' Swan, who moves from Phoenix, Arizona, to Forks, Washington. She is endangered after falling in love with Edward Cullen, a 103-year-old vampire frozen in his 17-year-old body.

movie.title: Jurassic Park
movie.description: A wealthy entrepreneur creates a theme park featuring genetically engineered dinosaurs, but the park's security system fails and the creatures escape.

book.title: Jurassic Park
book.author: Michael Crichton
book.description: A scientist creates a genetically-engineered island with living dinosaurs, but the creatures break free and chaos ensues.

movie.title: Forrest Gump
movie.description: The presidencies of Kennedy and Johnson, the Vietnam War, the Watergate scandal, and other historical events unfold from the perspective of an Alabama man with an extraordinary life story.

book.title: Forrest Gump
book.author: Winston Groom
book.description: The life of Forrest Gump, a slow-witted but kind-hearted man who unwittingly influences major events in U.S. history.

movie.title: The Great Gatsby
movie.description: A young man’s obsession with a beautiful woman leads to a tragic unraveling of his life as he seeks wealth, love, and status in 1920s New York.

book.title: The Great Gatsby
book.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
book.description: The story of the enigmatic Jay Gatsby, his unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan, and the tragic consequences of the American dream.

movie.title: The Shining
movie.description: A man takes a job as a winter caretaker of a remote hotel, only to slowly unravel into madness due to the supernatural forces within.

book.title: The Shining
book.author: Stephen King
book.description: A man, his wife, and his son take refuge in a remote hotel during the winter, only to face terrifying supernatural forces that test their sanity.

movie.title: The Social Network
movie.description: The story of the founding of Facebook, examining the conflict and betrayal between its founders and the legal battles that followed.

book.title: The Accidental Billionaires
book.author: Ben Mezrich
book.description: The true story of the creation of Facebook, chronicling the rise of Mark Zuckerberg and the disputes over the social network’s ownership.

movie.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
movie.description: A lawyer defends a black man accused of a crime he didn't commit, as seen through the eyes of his young daughter, in a racially divided town in the 1930s.

book.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
book.author: Harper Lee
book.description: A story of racial injustice and moral growth in the American South, narrated by young Scout Finch as her father, Atticus, defends a black man in a prejudiced society.

movie.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
movie.description: An orphaned boy named Harry Potter discovers he is a wizard on his 11th birthday and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he learns the truth about his past.

book.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
book.author: J.K. Rowling
book.description: Harry Potter, a young wizard, discovers his magical heritage and begins his journey at Hogwarts, uncovering secrets about his past and facing the dark forces that threaten the wizarding world.

movie.title: The Maze Runner
movie.description: Thomas wakes up with no memory in a giant maze and must work with others to find an escape while uncovering the secrets behind their captivity.

book.title: The Maze Runner
book.author: James Dashner
book.description: Thomas finds himself in the Glade, a mysterious environment surrounded by a vast maze. With no memories of his past, he must work with fellow Gladers to escape before it's too late.

book.title: Where the Sidewalk Ends
book.description: You'll meet a boy who turns into a TV set, and a girl who eats a whale. The Unicorn and the Bloath live there, and so does Sarah Cynthia Sylvia Stout who will not take the garbage out. It is a place where you wash your shadow and plant diamond gardens, a place where shoes fly, sisters are auctioned off, and crocodiles go to the dentist..

movie.title: Pulp Fiction
movie.description: The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.
